intro: Mertensia bakeri var. lateriflora, commonly known as the western bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its stems are often hairy. It is a perennial herb that blooms in early spring, adding a vibrant splash of color to its natural habitat.
